sen.j: 織田 信広（おだ のぶひろ、織田信廣、？ - 天正2年9月29日 (旧暦)（1574年10月13日））は戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Nobuhiro ODA (birth year unknown, passed away on October 13, 1574) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period.
Nobuhiro ODA (birth year unknown), who passed away on October 13, 1574, was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period.
Nobuhiro ODA (date of birth unknown - October 23, 1574) was a military commander in the period of warring states.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。グレゴリオ暦に変更

sen.j: 織田信秀の子。
sen.e: He was a son of Nobuhide ODA's.
He was a son of Nobuhide ODA.

sen.j: 織田信長の庶兄。
sen.e: He was Nobunaga ODA's elder brother by another mother.
He was Nobunaga ODA's elder brother by another mother.

sen.j: 実子は娘一人（丹羽長秀の正室）、養子に織田信正がいる。
sen.e: His biological child was a daughter (Nagahide NIWA's lawful wife) and his dopted child was Nobumasa ODA.
He had a daughter (who became Nagahide NIWA's wife) and an adopted son, Nobumasa ODA.
He had a daughter (who became Nagahide NIWA's wife) and an adopted son, Nobumasa ODA.

sen.j: 官位は大隅国守。

sen.j: 信秀の長男であるが、生母が側室という立場から家督の相続権はなかった。
sen.e: Although Nobuhiro was Nobuhide's eldest son, he didn't have a hereditary right to Oda's family estate because his mother was Nobuhide's concubine.
Although Nobuhiro was Nobuhide's eldest son, he didn't have a hereditary right to Oda's family estate because his mother was Nobuhide's concubine.
Although Nobuhiro was Nobuhide's eldest son, he didn't have a hereditary right to Oda's family estate because his mother was Nobuhide's concubine.

sen.j: 一般にも『信長の兄』とは認識されておらず、織田弾正忠家の一族扱いであった。
sen.e: In general, he was not regarded as "Nobunaga's elder brother" but as a member of Oda Danjonojo family.
In general, he was not regarded as Nobunaga's elder brother but as a member of the Oda Danjonojo family.
sen.cmt: I don't think speechmarks are necessary. 「the」挿入
sen.e: In general, he was not regarded as Nobunaga's elder brother but as a member of the Oda Danjonojo family.

sen.j: 天文 (元号)18年（1549年）11月、安祥城の城主時代に今川義元の軍師・太原雪斎に城を攻められ生け捕りにされる。
sen.e: In Nobember, 1549, when he was the lord of Ansho-jo Castle, Sessai TAIGEN, Yoshimoto IMAGAWA's strategist attacked the castle, and Nobuhiro was captured alive.
In November 1549, when he was the lord of Ansho-jo Castle, Sessai TAIGEN, Yoshimoto IMAGAWA's strategist, attacked the castle and Nobuhiro was captured alive.
In November 1549, when Nobuhiro was the lord of Ansho-jo Castle, Yoshimoto IMAGAWA's strategist Sessai TAIGEN attacked the castle and captured Nobuhiro alive.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 後に、織田家の人質となっていた松平竹千代（徳川家康）との人質交換という形で織田家へ送還される。
sen.e: Later he was sent back to the Oda clan in the form of exchanging hostages. At that time, Takechiyo MATSUDAIRA (Ieyasu TOKUGAWA), who was the Oda's hostage, was sent back to IMAGAWA.
Later he was sent back to the Oda clan through an exchange of hostages. At that time, Takechiyo MATSUDAIRA (Ieyasu TOKUGAWA), who was Oda's hostage, was sent back to IMAGAWA.
sen.cmt: 「in the form of exchanging」→「through an exchange of」, 「the」削除
sen.e: Later, Nobuhiro was sent back to the Oda clan in exchange for Oda's hostage Takechiyo MATSUDAIRA (Ieyasu TOKUGAWA).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後、弘治_(日本)2年（1556年）に美濃国稲葉山城の斎藤義龍と組んで清須城乗っ取りを図るなど一時期は信長と対立するが、やがて許される。
sen.e: Nobuhiro conflicted to Nobunaga for a while: in 1556, he tried to take over Kiyosu-jo Castle in conspiracy with Yoshitatsu SAITO. However, he was forgiven by Nobunaga.
There was conflict between Nobuhiro and Nobunaga for a while: in 1556, he tried to take over Kiyosu-jo Castle in conspiracy with Yoshitatsu SAITO. However, he was later forgiven by Nobunaga.
sen.cmt: 「Nobuhiro conflicted to」→「There was conflict between Nobuhiro and」, 「later」挿入
sen.e: There was conflict between Nobuhiro and Nobunaga for a while such that, in 1556, Nobuhiro tried to take over Kiyosu-jo Castle in conspiracy with Yoshitatsu SAITO of Inaba-jo Castle in Mino province; however, he was later forgiven by Nobunaga.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 以後は信長の家臣として、永禄12年（1569年）から元亀元年（1570年）まで京都に常駐して室町幕府との折衝役となり、元亀3年（1572年）の岩村城救援など、各地を転戦して武功を挙げた。
sen.e: After that, he served for Nobunaga. From 1569 to 1570, he stayed in Kyoto and worked as a liaison with Muromachi Bakufu. He moved from place to place to fight and accomplished military exploits such as the rescue of Iwamura-jo Castle in 1572.

After that, he served Nobunaga; from 1569 to 1570 he stayed in Kyoto and worked as a negotiator for the Muromachi Bakufu. He moved from place to place to fight and accomplished military exploits such as coming to the rescue of Iwamura-jo Castle in 1572.
sen.cmt: 「for」削除, 「.」→「;」, 「,」削除, 「liaison with」→「negotiator for the」, 「coming to」挿入
sen.e: After that, he served Nobunaga; from 1569 to 1570, he stayed in Kyoto and worked as a negotiator for the Muromachi bakufu; he moved from place to place to fight and accomplished military exploits such as coming to the rescue of Iwamura-jo Castle in 1572.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 天正元年（1573年）には、信長の名代として不和となった足利義昭と和議を結んでいる。
sen.e: In 1573, as Nobunaga's representative, he made a compromise with Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, who had been in discord with Nobunaga.
In 1573, as Nobunaga's representative, he made a compromise with Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, who had been in discord with Nobunaga.
In 1573, Nobuhiro, as Nobunaga's representative, made a compromise with Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, who had been in discord with Nobunaga.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 天正2年（1574年）、最後の伊勢国長島一向一揆攻めに参加。
sen.e: In 1574, Nobuhiro joined the last attack on Nagashima Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers in Nagashima) in Ise province.
In 1574, Nobuhiro joined the last attack on Nagashima Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers in Nagashima) in Ise province.
In 1574, Nobuhiro joined the last attack on the uprising of Ikko sect followers in Nagashima in Ise Province called 'Nagashima Ikko Ikki'.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 海陸からの兵糧攻めに耐えかね、9月29日 (旧暦)長島願証寺が降伏を申し出る。
sen.e: On September 29 (old calender), Nagashima Gansho-ji Temple, unable to stand the starvation policy both from land and sea, agreed to a surrender.
On September 29 (old calendar), Nagashima Gansho-ji Temple agreed to a surrender, unable to withstand the starvation policy both from land and sea.
On October 23, Nagashima Gansho-ji Temple was unable to withstand the starvation policy both from land and sea, agreed to a surrender.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 信長は偽ってこれを受け入れ、一揆勢が半ば願證寺を出た時点で一斉攻撃をかけた。
sen.e: Nobunaga pretended to accept the proposal, and made a rush on the rebels when about half of them left Gansho-ji Temple.
Nobunaga pretended to accept the proposal, but made a rush on the rebels just as about half of them left Gansho-ji Temple.
Nobunaga pretended to accept the proposal, but when just as about half of the rebels left Gansho-ji Temple, made a raid on them.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 一揆の総指揮をとっていた本願寺佐堯や下間頼旦は弾丸に倒れたが、騙し討ちに激怒した一揆兵は捨て身の反撃に出て寄せ手本陣に突入、支えきれず信広は討ち死にした。
sen.e: Sagyo of Hongan-ji Temple, Raitan SHIMOTSUMA. the leders of the uprising were shot and killed, and the surviving rebels became furious at the deception, fought back desperately and burst into the attackers' headquarters, which Nobuhiro couldn't stop. He died in the battle.

The Sagyo of Hongan-ji Temple and Raitan SHIMOTSUMA, the leaders of the uprising, were shot and killed, and the surviving rebels became furious at the deception, fought back desperately, and burst into the attackers' headquarters, which Nobuhiro couldn't stop. He died in the battle.

sen.e: Sagyo of Hongan-ji Temple, the leader of the uprising, and Raitan SHIMOTSUMA were shot and killed, and the surviving rebels became furious at the deception, fought back desperately and burst into the attackers' headquarters, which Nobuhiro couldn't stop and died in the battle.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 織田家の公的な家譜によれば、信広には男子はなく、娘は一人で信長の養女として丹羽長秀に嫁いでいる。
sen.e: According to the public record of the family trees of the Oda clan, Nobuhiro had no son and only one daughter, who married into the Nagahide NIWA family/clan as Nobunaga's adopted daughter.
According to the public record of the family trees of the Oda clan, Nobuhiro had no son and only one daughter, who married into the Nagahide NIWA clan as Nobunaga's adopted daughter.
According to the public record of the family trees of the Oda clan, Nobuhiro had a daughter, who married Nagahide NIWA as Nobunaga's adopted daughter, but did not have a son.

sen.j: 信憑性は薄いものの、異説によれば、このほか信州佐久郡武石に居住した武石五郎信興という男子がおり、娘には織田信正の正室恭姫、六角氏正統の六角義郷、八幡山秀綱の母千代君（『招提寺内興起後聞併年寄分由緒実録』）があるという。
sen.e: Although it is hard to believe, there is a rumor that Nobuhiro, (besides the daughter) had a son named Takeishi Goro Nobuoki, who lived in Takeishi, Saku county, Shinshu; another daughter, Kyohime, who was Nobumasa ODA's legal wife; and another daughter, Chiyogimi, the mother of both Yoshisato ROKKAKU, a member of the legitimate ROKKAKU clan and Hidetsuna HACHIMANYAMA ("招提寺内興起後聞併年寄分由緒実録").
sen.cmt: 『招提寺内興起後聞併年寄分由緒実録』の読み方不明です。
sen.e: Although it is hard to believe, there is a rumor that Nobuhiro had (besides the daughter) a son named Takeishi Goro Nobuoki, who lived in Takeishi, Saku county, Shinshu, another daughter, Kyohime, who was Nobumasa ODA's legal wife, and another daughter, Chiyogimi, the mother of both Yoshisato ROKKAKU, a member of the legitimate ROKKAKU clan and Hidetsuna HACHIMANYAMA ("招提寺内興起後聞併年寄分由緒実録").

According to another view ("招提寺内興起後聞併年寄分由緒実録"), although it lacks credibility, Nobuhiro also had a son named Takeishi Goro Nobuoki, who lived in Takeishi, Saku county, Shinshu; another daughter Kyohime, who was Nobumasa ODA's legal wife, and another daughter Chiyogimi, who was the mother of both Yoshisato ROKKAKU, a member of the legitimate ROKKAKU clan, and Hidetsuna HACHIMANYAMA.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 千代君の子である秀綱は織田家正統の後継者となった織田秀信の養子となったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that Hidetsuna, Chiyogimi's son, was adopted by Hidenobu ODA, the legitimate heir to the Oda family.
It is said that Hidetsuna, Chiyogimi's son, was adopted by Hidenobu ODA, the legitimate heir to the Oda family.
It is said that Chiyogimi's son Hidetsuna was adopted by Hidenobu ODA, the legitimate heir to the Oda family.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この場合秀綱が織田家を継承したとすると、女系ではあるが信広の血統に織田家の正統が移る。
sen.e: If Hidetsuna was the heir to the Oda family, Nobuhiro's blood line flowed into the legitimate Oda family through the maternal side.
If Hidetsuna was the heir to the Oda family, Nobuhiro's blood line was continued in the legitimate Oda family through the maternal side.
If Hidetsuna was the heir to the Oda family, Nobuhiro's bloodline was maintained in the legitimate Oda family through the maternal side.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 祖父の兄弟順、信長庶長子信正が信広の家を相続しているとすると父の兄弟順でも兄系が弾正忠家の嫡流となり、相応に正当性のある措置となることから、義郷、秀綱兄弟が実在したとするとこの養子縁組も行われていた可能性が高い。
sen.e: If the eldest son inherited the Nobumasa, Nobunaga's eldest son born out of wedlock inherited the Nobuhiro family, which means the eldest brother inherited the family. In the next generation, the eldest son was recognized as the main branch of Tadaie. Since both the heirs were treated with legitimacy, this adoption was probable if Yohisato and Hidetsuna actually existed.

If the eldest son inherited Nobumasa, Nobunaga's eldest son born out of wedlock inherited the Nobuhiro family, which means the eldest brother continued the line. In the next generation, the eldest son was recognized as the main branch of Tadaie. Since both the heirs were treated with legitimacy, this adoption was probable if Yoshisato and Hidetsuna actually existed.

If Nobumasa (Nobunaga's eldest son, who was born out of wedlock but later adopted by Nobunaga) became head of the Nobuhiro family, it means that the position of head of the main line of the Danjonojo family was passed to the eldest brother in subsequent generations; because both heirs were treated as legitimate, this adoption is highly probable if the brothers Yoshisato and Hidetsuna actually existed.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
